titles.title: Postal Privacy Act of 1993
To amend title 39, United States Code, to prevent the United States Postal Service from disclosing the names or addresses of any postal patrons or other persons, except under certain conditions.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H1261)
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 3/16/1993--Introduced. Postal Privacy Act of 1993 - Authorizes the Postal Service to permit its officers or employees to disclose the names and addresses of postal patrons if such disclosure: (1) consists of information relating to a change of address that was obtained on a Postal Service form which informed the patron of how the information would be disclosed and provided a means for the patron to deny disclosure; (2) has not been denied; and (3) would contribute to the efficiency of postal operations.
